wikipedia_page.main: Branko Bokun (28 June 1920–1 January 2011) was an author in the fields of sociology and psychology.

link_mentions.page: Relations between the Catholic Church and the state
response: Controversy surrounds the depths of the involvement of the Roman Catholic clergy with the Ustaše, a Croatian Fascist movement in the former Yugoslavia. According to Branko Bokun, a Roman Catholic priest made the following remarks on 13 June 1941:
Spy in the Vatican, 1941–45 is an autobiographical writing by author Branko Bokun. It was first published in 1973, in the United Kingdom by Tom Stacey and in the United States by Praeger.
* Branko Bokun (1920–2011),  Yugoslav-British author and journalist
